attributes.action: House of Lords to put by some of their surplus perks towards helping the young!
attributes.background: House of Lords are debating taking away from pensioners benefits mostly earnt during a long time paying into the tax system all their working life's to help the young .Well what a soft target to have a go at The house of Lords  members get paid  £300 a day  £6000 a month which is a year's pension

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the UK Government or Parliament to take a specific action.

We're not sure exactly what you'd like the Government or Parliament to do. In any case, allowances and expenses for Members of the House of Lords are matters for the House of Lords rather than the Government or Parliament as a whole. You can find out more here:

https://www.parliament.uk/business/lords/whos-in-the-house-of-lords/house-of-lords-expenses/

You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.
